COURSE.Definition: the way in which something develops

CONTINENT.Definition: one of the seven large land masses of earth

COLONISED.Definition: controlled by sending people to move and live there

SETTLERS.Definition: people moved from a country to live in another one

TERRITORIAL.Definition: related to the ownership and control of an area

SUCKED IN.Definition: involved someone without being their choice

COLONIES.Definition: countries controlled politically by a more powerful country

BARBARICALLY.Definition: in an extremely unpleasant and cruel way

COTTON.Definition: a soft white material used for making clothes

PLANTATIONS.Definition: a big area where crops (plants) are grown

GRADUAL.Definition: happening slowly over a period of time

SUBMISSION.Definition: the action of surrendering to a superior force

COLONISTS.Definition: people moved from a country to live in another one

MERCENARIES.Definition: professional soldiers hired to serve in a foreign army

CONTEXT.Definition: the conditions in which something exists

COMBINATION.Definition: a joining of different parts or factors

SPARKS.Definition: tiny bright pieces of burning material

METAPHOR.Definition: a way of describing something by referring to something else than has similar characteristics or behaviour

PRINCIPLE.Definition: a belief that acts as a basis for something

STAMP.Definition: a small piece of paper that is stuck on something to show that an amount of money has been paid

STAMPS.Definition: small pieces of paper that are stuck on something to show that an amount of money has been paid

SLOGAN.Definition: a short and easily remembered phrase

BOYCOTTING.Definition: refusing to buy a product as a way of expressing disapproval

CAME TO A HEAD.Definition: reached a point where action must be taken

VOLUNTEER.Definition: people who do something helpful willingly, without being forced to do so

HARBOUR.Definition: a place on the coast where ships and boats are kept safe

OVERBOARD.Definition: from the ship to the water

TENSIONS.Definition: state of difficulties and hostilities between two groups

MILITIA.Definition: a military force raised from civil population

FOUNDING FATHERS.Definition: a group of men who started the United States and wrote its constitution

TRAITORS.Definition: a person who betrays, acts against their country

IDEALS.Definition: standards or principles (beliefs that act as a basis for something)

CONSTITUTION.Definition: the set of political ideas by which a state is governed

DISTINCTIVE.Definition: easy to recognise because it is different from other similar things

EPIC.Definition: a poem that is long, impressive and grand in character

PAMPHLET.Definition: a small booklet that gives information about something

EMIGRATED.Definition: moved from one country to another to live there permanently

ANECDOTE.Definition: a short and interesting story about something someone has done

SENSATION.Definition: a wide reaction of interest and excitement

DEMOLISHES.Definition: destroys, proves that they are completely wrong

SOVEREIGNTY.Definition: authority, the governing power of a country

ELECTED.Definition: chosen by the people after a vote

SULLEN-TEMPERED.Definition: bad-tempered, easily annoyed or made angry

PHARAOH.Definition: an Egyptian ruler (used here to show the absolute rule of the king)

GATHERED PACE.Definition: started to happen more quickly and had more success

SOUND BITE.Definition: a small interesting and effective phrase

UNALIENABLE.Definition: incapable of being taken away because it is their right

PURSUIT.Definition: the act of trying to achieve something

CLAUSE.Definition: a separate section of a writing

CONDEMNED.Definition: showed or said that something is wrong

INHUMAN.Definition: without the human qualities of love and mercy

PEAK.Definition: the point of its highest quantity

LOYALISTS.Definition: a group that strongly supports a ruler

TO BE RECKONED WITH.Definition: worth taking seriously because of being powerful

FLEET.Definition: the ships of a country's naval military forces

GOD-GIVEN.Definition: coming from God and not people

IDEALISM.Definition: strong belief that you will achieve what you think is right

GRIPPING.Definition: having a strong effect, very interesting

EXAGGERATION.Definition: to say that something is more important than it is

GOVERNED.Definition: the citizens of a governing state

CONSTITUTIONS.Definition: sets of political ideas by which states are governed

MONARCH.Definition: a ruling head of state, usually a king or queen

HEREDITARY.Definition: that is passed on as a right by a parent to a child

ARISTOCRACY.Definition: the highest class in certain societies that is considered superior

ASPIRATION.Definition: hope or ambition to achieve something

INTERFERENCE.Definition: involvement of others in their own affairs

MASSES.Definition: a large number of people crowded together

ANXIETY.Definition: a feeling of worry and nervousness

CULT-LIKE.Definition: similar to a cult (a system of usually secret beliefs that are considered sacred)
